DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study determine effect Semielevated Side-Lying ( ESL ) Semielevated Supine Position ( ESU ) position use bottle-feeding preterm infant upon physiological characteristic feed performance .
DOC.brief_title: Effect Feeding Positions Preterm Infants Some Physiological Characteristics
DOC.detailed_description: Semielevated supine position ( ESU ) position frequently use neonatal intensive care unit . In position , infant lay feed back head elevate angle 45-60° order reduce respiratory load lung . The ESL position , head infant elevate angle 45-60° infant feed side-lying position . Since position mimic breast-feeding position , preterm infant support utilize advantage breast-feeding . A randomization provide sample group consist totally 80 infant 38 infant include ESL ( experimental ) group , 42 infant include ESU ( control ) group.In power analysis repeat end study , power study determine 87 % reliability 95 % .
DOC.criteria: To bear 2631+6 gestational week accord mother 's last menstruation date , To 3239+6 postmenstrual week study , Have body weight 1500 g , Have full enteral feeding , To transition orogastric catheter feed oral feeding le 24 hour , Have oral feeding process least , Tolerate least 80 % amount food give lastly oral feeding , Voluntarily sign write informed consent form parent Infants suffer craniofacial abnormality like cleft palate , cleave lip facial muscle paralysis ; gastrointestinal , neurological genetic disorder ( necrotising enterocolitis , intracranial haemorrhage , periventricular leukomalacia , hydrocephalia , syndrome , omphalocele , gastroschisis , short bowel syndrome etc . ) moderate severe bronchopulmonary dysplasia ( BPD ) ( Jobe & Bancalari , 2001 ) patent ductus arteriosus require surgical therapy exclude study
